original: Āmantā.🔽Nanu aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo vutto bhagavatā, seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: āmantā  nanu aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā
sammā diṭṭhi pe sammā samādhi iti
translated: “Isn’t the eightfold path stated by the Blessed One, that is, right view … right concentration?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo vutto bhagavatā, seyyathidaṁ—🔽sammādiṭṭhi …pe… sammāsamādhi, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā  sammādiṭṭhi pe sammāsamādhi no ca vata re vattabbe

translated: “Then you shouldn’t say that the path is fivefold.”
“Isn’t it said by the Blessed One:
‘The eightfold path is the best of paths,
The four truths are the best of words.
Dispassion is the best of things,
And the one with vision is the best of bipeds.’

original: Sammāvācā maggaṅgaṁ, sā ca na maggoti?
analyzed: sammā vācā sā ca na maggā iti
translated: “Right speech is a factor of the path, but it is not the path?”

original: Sammādiṭṭhi maggaṅgaṁ, sā ca na maggoti?
translated: “Right view is a factor of the path, but it is not the path?”

original: sammāvācā maggaṅgaṁ, sā ca na maggoti?
analyzed: sammā vācā sā ca na maggā iti
translated: “Right speech is a factor of the path, but it is not the path?”

original: sammāsamādhi maggaṅgaṁ, so ca na maggoti?
translated: Right concentration is a factor of the path and it is not the path?”

original: sammāājīvo maggaṅgaṁ, so ca na maggoti?
analyzed: sammāājīvaḥ so ca na maggo ti
translated: Right livelihood is a factor of the path and it is not the path?”

original: sammādiṭṭhi …pe… sammāsamādhi maggaṅgaṁ, so ca na maggoti?
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhi pe sammāsamādhi so ca na maggoti
translated: “Right view … Right concentration is a factor of the path and it is not the path?”
“Is right view a factor of the path and the path?”
“Is right speech a factor of the path and the path?”
“Is right view a factor of the path and the path?”
Right livelihood a factor of the path and the path?”

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  sammāsaṅkappaḥ pe

translated: Right concentration a factor of the path and the path?”
Right livelihood a factor of the path and the path?”

original: Nanu vuttaṁ bhagavatā—🔽“pubbeva kho panassa kāyakammaṁ vacīkammaṁ ājīvo suparisuddho hoti;
analyzed: nanu vuttam bhagavatā  pubbā iva kho panassa kāya kammam vacī kammam ājīvo su parisuddhaḥ hoti
translated: “Hasn’t it been said by the Buddha:

original: evamassāyaṁ ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo bhāvanāpāripūriṁ gacchatī”ti.
analyzed: evam assa ayam ariyaḥ aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggaḥ bhāvanā pāripūrim gacchati iti
translated: ‘Before his bodily and verbal actions and livelihood have been purified, a monk develops the noble eightfold path to its culmination.’
“Well then, the path has five factors.”

original: Nanu vuttaṁ bhagavatā—🔽“yasmiṁ kho, subhadda, dhammavinaye ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo na upalabbhati, samaṇopi
analyzed: nanu vuttam bhagavatā  yasmin kho subhadda dhamma vinaye ariyaḥ aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggaḥ na upalabbhati samaṇaḥ api
translated: “Hasn’t it been said by the Buddha:

original: tattha na upalabbhati, dutiyopi tattha samaṇo na upalabbhati, tatiyopi tattha samaṇo🔽na upalabbhati, catutthopi tattha samaṇo na upalabbhati.
analyzed: tattha na upalabbhati dutiyaḥ pi tattha samaṇo na upalabbhati tatiyaḥ pi tattha samaṇo  na upalabbhati catutthaḥ api tattha samaṇaḥ na upalabbhati
translated: ‘Subhadda, in any Dhamma and Discipline where the noble eightfold path is not found, no ascetic or brahmin can be found who is a perfected one or a disciple of a perfected one.

original: Yasmiñca kho, subhadda, dhammavinaye ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo upalabbhati, samaṇopi tattha upalabbhati, dutiyopi …pe… tatiyopi …pe… catutthopi tattha samaṇo upalabbhati.
analyzed: yasmin ca kho subhadda dhamma vinaye ariyaḥ aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo upalabbhati samaṇaḥ api tattha upalabbhati dutiyaḥ pi pe tatiyaḥ pi pe catutthaḥ pi tattha samaṇaḥ upalabbhati
translated: But in any Dhamma and Discipline where the noble eightfold path is found, there a perfected one or a disciple of a perfected one can be found.

original: Imasmiṁ kho, subhadda, dhammavinaye ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo upalabbhati. Idheva, subhadda,🔽samaṇo, idha dutiyo samaṇo, idha tatiyo samaṇo, idha catuttho samaṇo. Suññā parappavādā🔽samaṇebhi aññehī”ti.🔽Attheva suttantoti?
analyzed: imasmin kho subhadda dhamma vinaye ariyaḥ aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo upalabbhati idha iva subhadda  samaṇaḥ idha dutiyaḥ samaṇaḥ idha tatiyaḥ samaṇaḥ idha catuttho samaṇaḥ suññā parappavādā  samaṇebhi aññehi iti  atthā iva suttanto ti
translated: In this Dhamma and Discipline the Noble Eightfold Path is found. Here, Subhadda,

analyzed: āmantā 🔽tena hi aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo ti 🔽magga kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: there is an ascetic, here a second ascetic, here a third ascetic, here a fourth ascetic. Empty are the doctrines of other sectarians with ascetics alone.
